intro: Syngonanthus allenii var. brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian arrowroot, is a herbaceous plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the family Cyclanthaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces edible tubers that are used in traditional medicine and as a food source. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a preference for moist, shaded environments. It is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and overharvesting.
